page.title: 06Callow End Village.
page.content: Was once owned by Earl Beauchamp.King Charles II stayed at Prior's Court before the Battle of Worcester. There is a 100 yr old chapel down Beauchamp Lane,converted into 4 houses, and an old manor house. The village consists of 2 pubs,a 300 yr old PO building,a butchery and a bakery (both over 100 yrs),a garage, and a General Store (1954) called Pound Stores because of the ancient animal pound which was nearby. The Men's Club opened in 1908.The two farms in the village are Nixon Court Farm and Rodgman's Farm. St. James' Anglican church was built in 1887. There are still Benedictine nuns at Stanbrook Abbey (see page 16).
